name: 约翰·布朗约翰
name_full: 约翰·布朗约翰 John Brownjohn
introduction: Originally a Classicist whose school diet from age eight included ancient Greek as well as Latin, John Brownjohn won a major scholarship to Oxford, from where he graduated with honors. Thereafter, partly because he hails from a ramified family whose members fought on both sides during World War II, he made the transition to modern languages and a career as a literary translator that has earned him critical acclaim and many British and American awards. In addition to translating the better part of two hundred books, he has produced English versions of many German and French screenplays and co-written several feature films with Roman Polanski, including Tess, Pirates, Bitter Moon, and The Ninth Gate.
